Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Ryan W A
Reviews.Content: Hotel looks great from the outside and the lobby but upon further review. My bathroom had spiders big and small pillows were dirty bathtubs were filthy unacceptable. But again you get what you pay for $60 room and was cleaned as such would not ever stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: MsAJT
Reviews.Content: I have been to this hotel a number of times. And the rooms are wonderful. I have never had a dirty room or bad service.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: atb416
Reviews.Content: This hotel is off the beaten track and the area looks a little seedy, but once you get there, it was an excellent experience. The lobby was clean and looked recently remodelled. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The room was immaculate, quiet, and pretty spacious for the cost. Don't let the location deter you from choosing this place.

Reviews.Title: “Truckers rule”
Reviews.Author: Barry D
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel, needs a little updating but I stay here pretty often the price is fair, the staff treats you nice. The rooms are fresh & clean most times and I get a good quiet nights rest. This Best Western is convenient to a lot of stores and restaurants. There is Also truck parking for truckers.

Reviews.Title: “Yes I would return here”
Reviews.Author: sweetm
Reviews.Content: I was unsure what to expect after reading some of the reviews here, but the price was right and location was exactly where I needed to be. I was pleasantly surprised. My room was clean, warm, and QUIET. I had a restful night. The staff was quite nice too. I had some work in Baltimore and would need a fax later in the day. The staff said that sure i could come back and use their business center and fax machine. The only glitch i experienced was the stairs. I have bad knees and had slow going on the stairs. An elevator would have been nice, the staff did offer to move me, but for safety sake I didn't want a ground floor. The receptionist also recommended a nice close by restaurant with GREAT crab-cakes... a treat for a former Marylander.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for a one night stay.”
Reviews.Author: Rasika_Raghavan
Reviews.Content: We were on our way to DC and stayed here for one night. Though the hotel was right off the highway, the room was quiet. The room was just ok. A bit tacky with an oversized TV cabinet making the room seem very small. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was a bit outdated. There is no wi-fi in the rooms, just an internet cable. The staff were helpful and the check in and check out were very quick. We wont stay here again for a single reason that breakfast was not up to the mark. There was not much of choice, so everyone was waiting for the waffles. There was just one waffle maker. We waited for some fifteen minutes, then we left, as it was upsetting our schedule. Kind of spoilt the mood of the trip that day, as we had to travel on an empty stomach.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, clean, a value!”
Reviews.Author: Defuntimers
Reviews.Content: Nice location right off of 695. Close to Security Square Mall. Clean, well appointed rooms. Friendly staff that are attentive to requests.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: Donnamay55
Reviews.Content: This hotel is older and a little dated. But it was clean, a good value, and convenient to BWI Airport. The staff was helpful and friendly and any problems were corrected immediately. They do not have wifi in the rooms, but did have service available by ethernet cable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Motel”
Reviews.Author: psuag
Reviews.Content: I was very worried when I read other reviews. They were either wrong or just mean. Clean, decent place. Front desk staff very helpful. I am here for four nights and so far - it is great. Room is nice for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Overall,a nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sweetpea1217
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bestwestern the beginning of Sept.for almost 2 weeks.The first room I checked into had a strong foul odor.Which,I reported and was handled immediately.The staff was very friendly and helpful.The carpet and tub was dirty.Housekeeping on the second floor made my stay very uncomfortable asking for tips/money not to mention I had a DO NOT DISTURB sign on my door and they opened it anyway.I thought that was really rude.I reported this to the staff and they handled that situation promptly.The staff here will work to make sure you enjoy your stay.I can say that in spite of the few negative things that happened I really enjoyed my stay and would definitely stay there again.One other thing.They do have a nice continental breakfast and the lady that works in that area is very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay, Will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: unctigger
Reviews.Content: We were up for the weekend and stayed here. We got there before check in time but they allowed us to check in early with no extra charge. The staff was real friendly, all of them, right down to the pool life gaurd. He even called around to check on restaurants for us. The room was to be expected, had a tub, two beds, tv, desk, and even a little couch chair and table. It was a pretty good size room had plenty of room for us and the five year old to be active. We had a very pleasant stay and will definitely be back to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “BE CAREFUL OF THE NOISES UNDER YOUR BED!!!”
Reviews.Author: Toddpop
Reviews.Content: I had to be at an early morning event at the Martin's West facility, and this was the closest place to stay. Photos looked good, so I booked it. First off, the area is not the greatest.... pretty scary mall nearby, and restaurants are slim pickings. I checked in, and while unpacking, I heard scurrying and scratching under my bed. I asked for (and was promptly given) another room. This is a older motel/hotel, with most rooms having direct outside access, which includes all the outside noise problems as well. Doors and windows not sealed well. I slept okay, but not great. When checking out, I saw a note on the credenza behind the desk clerk- topped with another room number, in big letters it said "Dead mouse in tub"! I will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A bargain for the money! very clean and quiet!”
Reviews.Author: justbeingme38
Reviews.Content: We wanted something away from the hustle and bustle of Baltimore, yet close enough so we could go sightseeing. This was an ideal, quiet, yet refreshing location. The place was immaculate, and the staff very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Monnie215
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a place close to where i had to be for work. I liked this one hotel about 20 minutes away but was looking for something a little cheaper. The Best Western chain is normally clean and basic. This was awful. it was more like a motel with the doors going directly outside. The lighting wasn't to bad, but I still did not feel safe walking to my room. The room was dirty. When inspecting for bed bugs I ran across Chip crumbs all under the matress and on the side by the bed. (No bed bugs though) The perimeter of the room was covered in dust and I located 2 dead flies. It was obvious the vaccum only gets ran in the basic areas, not behind the chair or desk, and the hose attachment is never used. (Picture attached) There was a tear in the curtains, and the towl rack was hanging on and needed to be rehung with nails. Overall you get what you pay for and I will break down and spend the extra money next time somewhere else. I booked for 3 nights and only made it through 2 before I checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Horrible!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MzMarshall
Reviews.Content: This is the worst Best Western we've ever visited. Upon booking the reservtion via the internet the rooms were supposed to be equipped with refrigerators and microwaves. We booked for 2 days. We went out got stuff for the fridge that didn't exist and were told by the front desk staff that those LUXURIES had to be requested in advance. The sheets and blanket on the bed were covered with long strands of hair. Did I mention that they also smelled awful and were brown(the sheets) from not being washed? The carpet was soaked from the brown stuff leaking from the ceiling near the sink. The toilet was also backed up. We asked to be transferred to another a room and were told that that was not possible. The only good thing I CAN say about this hotel is that the Lady at the front desk was very nice upon our arrival but was off for the rest of our stay. If you haven't already.....DON'T DO IT!!!!!!!!!! Find some place else! One more thing...There was also a comedy show happening that weekend and we left only to return and find out that there was no place for us to park. We walked from the other side of the hotel to our dungeon.

Reviews.Title: “gross bugs not clean”
Reviews.Author: princessv1724
Reviews.Content: This hotel was horrible. We had checked in and then went out for dinner. When we returned I had changed for bed and pulled down the conforter to find that someone had already slept on the sheets and they were not changed. I called to the front desk to get get clean sheets and the guy at the front desk went to another room and pulled the sheets off that bed. I told my husband to ask where he got the sheets from and he said from the front desk and I said he was lying. We asked for a diffrent room and was alowed to inspect that room before we moved our stuff. My husband went into the other room and there was a dead cockaroach in the bed and a lice bug crawling on the pillow. My husband said we are not staying here and the front desk mgr sent us to the Best western on odonnell ave baltimore. I got a full refund for our booking.

Reviews.Title: “Good price and location.”
Reviews.Author: brent333
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind driving on the highway for 20 minutes into downtown Baltimore, then this is a good place to stay. It is only a few blocks away from the highway, gas stations, stores/services and a major shopping centre. The price was right. Ask for a room on the oppposite side of the highway or facing the pool. (as it would be noisy on the wrong side). The breakfast room could do with more chairs and tables. There was a computer and printer for guests to use free of charge. Dinner was at the mall at an all you can eat buffet (roast beef, seafood, dessert among many items) for only $11 per person. A great value at "Cactus Willies".

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SUEBE76
Reviews.Content: -Front desk was very helpful and fast. We wanted a room with a microwave and fridge and when we saw our room did not have these,they immediately moved us to a room that had them and called to see if we liked it. -Clean-but they do need new carpeting !!!!!!!!! -RIGHT next to Martin's West so location was perfect! -Air conditioning was wonderful on a 103 degree day! -Front desk recommended City View Bar and Grill -close and food to die for! http://www.cityviewbaltimore.com/ -didn't have time to use the pool but looked beautiful! -room had coffee station/iron ironing board/hair dryer/microwave,refrigerator/cable tv We would definitely stay there again !

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were nice and location worked great”
Reviews.Author: stephenjoyner77
Reviews.Content: I was traveling south from Philadelphia and I found this hotel in a discount guide that I picked up at one of the rest stops. The rooms were exterior exits but I thought overall the drive up looked fine. Well, turned out to be a good hotel. Rooms were updated with granite in the bathrooms and the bed was pretty comfortable. TV worked good and the internet worked good. Staff was not "hilton" but for $69 they were pretty good! Overall, i liked the stay and I would stay again. I saw 2 other hotels in the area, and this really did look the best!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: GM22081
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel if you can. I woke up with over 20 bed bug bites. My co-worker who stayed in this hotel a month ago found a playful little mouse in the middle of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: thelarish
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed a night at this Best Western over Halloween weekend. We actually enjoyed that it was not so close to Baltimore City especially on such a busy night. We felt relatively safe. While 695 is next to the hotel, I did not hear much noise from the traffic at all. The room was quite clean and very roomy for the price we paid ($60). The bathroom was a little shabby, but not disgusting as I've witnessed in other places. It is conveniently located up the block from several shopping centers, which saved us money on food before we ventured on our trip to the city. Overall, I'd say that if you're looking to spend one or two nights in a relatively safe, clean, place, and have access to a car and are willing to drive to get to attractions, then this place is definitely worth it for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Reunion Rooms were terrific”
Reviews.Author: Lamark12
Reviews.Content: We had our family reunion in Baltimore this month and we used the Best Western. The rooms were very nice and comfortable. Our room was on the court yard which opened up to the pool. The kids loved the pool and we enjoyd our stay very much. We will be returning next year and I would recomend this hotel to anyone traveling to Baltimore

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Awful!”
Reviews.Author: flfd14
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel primarily because of the price and previous stays at Best Western hotels. First off, be aware that Baltimore "West" is nowhere near the inner harbor/downtown area! When attempting to locate the hotel with my GPS it was unable to find the address in "Baltimore". Instead, I ended up on the "other" Belmont Avenue which is in the middle of one of the worst neighborhoods possible! When checking into the hotel, I was given a room all the way in the back of the property, which I did not mind because I thought it would be quiet back there. The real "fun" began when I opened the door to the room- there was an awful, musty smell in the room that I tried to dispel with some spray. The bathroom was filthy, and worst of all---> the bedsheets were covered with various hairs from "various" parts of one's body (the sheets OBVIOUSLY weren't washed!) and best of all, there were 2 winged insects of some sort underneath the covers. Upon asking the fromt desk for a refund, I was denied because Hotels.com does some kind of direct billing.... either way, I sucked up the $ loss and headed to the Sheraton, which cost me a pretty penny, but at least I slept soundly! (and in a CLEAN bed) Beware!!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price, but needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: Desi_traveler_77
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when we were attending a function at Martin's West, as said earlier this hotel is litteraly in the parking lot. As a first impression, the front desk staff were very friendly, asked me where we would prefer to stay, what side, 1st or 2nd floor. Even when checking out the gentleman at the front desk was very nice, reminding us about the free breakfast buffet and asking about the stay. The rooms are a little worn down. The hotel is the type where all the room face outside to a running balcony. We had a room on the second floor facing 695. The rooms are loud, you can hear large trucks that are passing by on the interstate. The rooms are a decent size, we had a double with two queens. The overall room was clean, although in dire need of renovation. The carpet and the furnishings all looked pretty old. The one nice thing is the toliet and shower are separate from the sink. There is a nice full length mirror though which was nice when trying to get ready. The area that the hotel is in isn't that great, nor is it all that bad. With Martin's west next door, there are occasionally some shady charactors that hang around. At night there were a lot of people in the parking lot just lingering, which was not exactly comforting with the external rooms. Overall, the hotel is ok. We paid $75. So for the amount we paid i have to say the hotel was not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service...Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: quietcentaur5
Reviews.Content: When I first arrived, I was disturbed because they didn't have the original rate of the hotel price booked through Kayak.com. They fixed that problem. As my family moved into the hotel room, there were a few problems with some things. The desk which HAD a cord connected to it which it was severed, toilet paper roll holder was falling out of the wall, tv didn't work and sheets weren't cleaned. The maid obviously didn't do her job or report any problems. They moved us to the next room which was fine. We came to find out there was a hole in a pipe so our carpet was a bit wet a couple days later. They moved us to the next room and knocked out the most expensive night which was Tuesday for the inauguration. The last room was great and we had no problems. I had already received a great price for the hotel but after the incidents, it was even better. $494 for 6 nights to 375 for 6 nights. The hotel attendants were very friendly and very helpful. As well, the breakfast had bagels, bread, muffins, hard boiled eggs and fresh fruit and juice to start one's day. Overall I had a great experience in the hotel. Very safe place. Great manager of the hotel. I appreciate my visit and when I come back to Baltimore/DC, I will definitely stay there. If you are looking for upscale hotel, this isn't the place but if you need a place to stay so you can lay your head and relax, its a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Western Ever!”
Reviews.Author: jahsangel25
Reviews.Content: I understand that standard check-in time is 3:00 pm, however we arrived at the best western earlier than scheduled (12:00 noon). Initially we were very understanding of that fact and so we left and came back around 2:30 pm hoping that a room would be available. I spoke with a hotel representative via telephone, who again informed me that check-in is 3:00 pm and no rooms are available until then. I was highly disappointed and cannot understand how a room could not be provided to us being as though we were only a half hour away from the check-in time. I understand that there was a large party of guest who stayed over the night before, but what I am having a hard time believing is that not one single room was cleaned and available by 2:30 pm. I informed the rep. that me and my associate needed to change for a meeting and it was imperative that we have a room. At no time did Jordyn try to make accommodations for us. We had no choice but to wheel our luggage in to the hotel’s public bathroom and change our attire in the cramped quarters of the stall!!! How gross is that!!! I will never stay here or recommend this place to anyone. Not even a dog!

Reviews.Title: “A quiet stay, no problems”
Reviews.Author: Esrie
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried given some earlier reviews of this hotel, but my stay was fine. I spent three weeknights while my mother was recovering from surgery at nearby Kernan hospital. The room was clean and well furnished with pretty recent stuff; the fridge, microwave, TV and everything all worked just fine. The bed was pretty comfy and the shower was hot in the morning. I wish the cable selection included more channels like Bravo and SciFi, but it was ok. I had a room overlooking the pool, and so I didn't hear much traffic noise. It was midweek and there didn't seem to be many people, so I didn't hear any external or neighbor noise. I can see how if there were people outside in a party mood (on the weekend maybe) the voices would carry. I used the fitness room which was ok, though the counter on the elliptical was a little fritzy. I stopped in for breakfast one morning, which was just bagels and sweet rolls etc but was ok, too. For free high-speed internet, they'll give you a cable at the front desk since they don't have wireless. It was really convenient to Kernan, down the road from fast food restaurants, and just across the street from a mall with a grocery store where I got some food to heat up. The property itself is back from the main business area, up a side road, so there's not much local traffic. I'm a single middle-aged woman and I felt pretty safe. There was a delay the night I checked in when nobody was at the desk, but the security guard was there and was very nice and went to find a desk clerk. Overall, it was pretty standard motel fare: maybe not quite worth the price given that it's still just really a motel, but comparable to what else is in the area. And it does seem like they're trying to get their act together and provide good service to their customers.

Reviews.Title: “They lost my clothing !”
Reviews.Author: Catwoman22
Reviews.Content: I'd been out of my room from early morning 'til evening and when I went to get dressed for bed, I noticed that some of my clothing was missing. I immediately called the front desk because the maids had cleaned my room that morning. The person at the front desk said she'd look in the garbage for my clothing. I don't believe she ever did. She told me later that night to make a list of what was missing and present the list at checkout the next morning. At checkout they told me the general manager would contact me within the day. I waited 'til the next day, and when no one had contacted me, I phoned the hotel. I was told the general manager went on vacation. I asked if someone else could deal with this problem since the general manager was away. I was told that one of two people would phone me back. I waited about three days for someone to phone me back, but they never did. I phoned the hotel again and asked for housekeeping. The head of housekeeping (who had the same last name as the general manager) said she'd look in the lost and found. She didn't find my things in lost and found. She said she'd talk to her staff who'd cleaned my room on the day in question and phone me back in a couple days. The phone call never came. I then phoned the 800 complaint line for Best Western. I was told I had to wait until a week after I'd checked out to file a complaint. I phoned the 800 number back a couple days later and filed a complaint. They told me that the hotel's general manager had 7 days to respond. After 7 days passed, the 800 number phoned me and said the general manager had made no response. I then filed an on-line complaint. Again, zero satisfaction. The *ONLY* satisfaction I received was from American Express because I'd charged my airline ticket on my American Express card and I have trip insurance. My clothing loss was covered under my trip insurance.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were nice”
Reviews.Author: workinhard
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had to travel down to Baltimore for a wedding this past weekend. The wedding was held at Martins West which is almost in the parking lot of this hotel. We were prepared for the worst after seeing some reviews on hotels.com. We arrived and the gentlemen on the desk was very nice. This hotel has rooms that open to the outside like the old style highway motels. The rooms were comfortable and the carpet looked brand new. The decor was a little dated but other than that, the room was good. The bathroom had a cruved shower curtain and everything was clean. We walked to the wedding and I thought it was ok for the price. It is not a four star hotel by any stretch, but ok for 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: speedbump52
Reviews.Content: After booking on Hotwire, and reading the reviews on Tripadvisor, I was quite worried. However, the staff was courteous, the room was clean (with a definite oder of new carpet), and the complimentary breakfast was better than I expected. Obviously, they are trying to get their act together. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Western is more like it”
Reviews.Author: bluejay888
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night during a business conference. We switched rooms several times because they either did not have adequate heat or smelled bad. Mind you this is after several hours of driving and a trade show with a two year old. When we finally settled for the smelly but warm room, with a non-working phone, it was 12:30 AM. The continental breakfast was meager but worst of all the dairy products were not in ice, they were warm to the touch. I decided against eating anything when I found my butter pat was moldy. The manager seemed to want to help but this hotel is so far beyond bad, I think they may want to just start over. At least drop the prices. If I knew this was a cheap, bad hotel that's one thing but we were under the impression this was a decent mid-line Best Western hotel. Hot tips for the management: 1)Fix the heaters in all the rooms 2)eliminate the smells in the rooms 3)Make sure your food is being stored and displayed safely 4)the decor seems new and tasteful, hopefully everything else will catch up soon.

Reviews.Title: “worst western!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jobloggs
Reviews.Content: Ten of us travelled from England to attend a family wedding. We had three rooms between us none of which were of a decent standard. We had to move rooms three times (during what would have been a two week stay) due to a leaky bath, bad smells, poor ventilation and a visit from a mouse (which seemed to be a recurring problem as there were several Rentokil traps on the premises)! The maids were hopeless and their cleaning methods were shocking(cleaning the bath with a dry towel)! During our stay we witnessed several other similar complaints being made. The staff on the front desk were about as useful as a chocolate teapot! Our problems were only resolved when we spoke to the manager who tried to help but by this time we had had enough and decided to leave to find alternative accommodation. My advice to anyone contemplating staying here would be DON'T!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! This hotel is more like a motel than a hotel and may be suitable for a 1 or 2 night stay but any longer, don't bother!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: bigcorals
Reviews.Content: Ok first off, when I got to the hotel they acted like I never made reservations. The only reason we stayed there was because we were attending a wedding reception next door and needed a place to stay. We had no lights in the vanity. No hot water in the shower. No cold water in the vanity. When we ran the cold water in the shower, the bathtub wouldnt drain. The bride and groom also stayed at the hotel and they had to sleep in the floor because their bedding hadnt been changed. They also had left over food in their room. It was pure disgusting! The hotel says they have security but they werent around when a fight broke out in the middle of the night. The brides car was also damaged during the one night stay. I wouldnt recommend this hotel to anyone. It's a dump and most of the staff are complete idiots. OH and one more thing. It was the middle of July when we stayed there and the A/C wasnt even on when we got to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As a Brit, I would describe the place as a "motel" and not a hotel. Access to the rooms was from outside as opposed to inside via corridors. The room was large, with two double beds and an ensuite. Was furnished comfortably and had coffee making facilities. My only small gripe as they one time we used the restaurant on site the service was poor as there was a large party/function going on next door. The location was handy for the freeways and local shoping. Would use the facility again.

Reviews.Title: “I Agree Worst Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: rcsaltydog
Reviews.Content: Poor Service, Unhabitable rooms, illegal activity, all night partying and drinking A disgrace to the Holiday Inn Name

Reviews.Title: “great stay great people”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: very good stay helpful staff newly renovated lots of work being done to improve valuable property

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here and had a good time at the hotel. The rooms are nice and they are installing a lot of new things at the hotel. The breakfast and service was nice. The hotel was packed and all staf were friendly and hospitable to me and my family

Reviews.Title: “A terrible stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: That has got to be the worst Holiday inn, that we have ever stayed at. We have stayed at several Holiday inns, and never seen one so disgusting, in our entire lifes. The tub was peeling paint in large quantities, so we were not able to give our little one a bath. The shower curtain had mildew on it. The ceiling in the living room had mold forming on it. Enough said!!! By the way this was room 119, so stay clear of this room!!!!!!

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Baltimore West
HotelInfo.Address: 1800 Belmont Ave., Baltimore, MD 21244
